Class Fachada

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.ubu.XRayDetector.modelo.Fachada

  • public class Fachada
extends java.lang.Object
    Facade pattern. Class that controls the logic of the application.
    Author:
    Joaquín Bravo Panadero , Adrián Gonzalez Duarte

      • ejecutaEntrenamiento

        public void ejecutaEntrenamiento(java.io.File arff,
                        java.lang.String originalDirectory)
        Executes the training. This trainning can be using an ARFF file, or an image directory for make a new ARFF file.
        Parameters:
        arff - The ARFF file used for the training. If not exist an image directory is used.
        originalDirectory - Image directory used for training. This is used if an ARFF file is not specified.

      • obtenerListaPixelesBlancos

        private java.util.ArrayList<int[]> obtenerListaPixelesBlancos(ij.ImagePlus img,
                                                    int xIni,
                                                    int yIni,
                                                    int height,
                                                    int width,
                                                    int iniX,
                                                    int iniY)
        Gets the ArrayList of white pixels.
        Parameters:
        img - The image.
        xIni - The initial X coordinate.
        yIni - The Initial Y coordinate.
        height - The height of the selection set.
        width - The width of the selection set.
        iniY - initial point in cropped image (x).
        iniX - initial point in cropped image (y).
        Returns:
        An arraylist of white pixels.

        Parameters:

        listaCoordenadas - Arraylist of coordinates.
        Returns:

      • binarizarMatriz

        public void binarizarMatriz(int[][] defectsMatrix2)
        Binary a Matrix. If the value of a matrix exceeds the threshold, the value is set to 1. Else the value is set to 0.
        Parameters:
        defectsMatrix2 - The defect matrix.

      • getPrecisionRecall

        public double[] getPrecisionRecall(java.lang.String path,
                          java.awt.Rectangle selection)
        Gets the precision and recall values.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the mask of the image used.
        selection - The selection over the image. If don't exists the entire image is used.
        Returns:
        An array with the precission and recalll values. [0] == Precision. [1] == Recall.
